meaningMnemonic: A violent <radical>tsunami</radical> causes <radical>flowers</radical> to be ripped from the branches of trees and they swirl around and <radical>kiss</radical> your face gently as they <kanji>fall</kanji>. With the tsunami came a great windy storm that blew many flowers all about. It’s a pretty sight amongst all the destruction.
readingMnemonic: You want to save these flowers you see <kanji>fall</kanji>ing in around you, so you take out a drying <reading>rack</reading> (らく) and place them carefully on it. Now whenever you feel scared, you can look at the flowers on this rack and you won't be scared anymore.
